intro: Eritrichium falcatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, basal rosette of leaves and small, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cold, dry environments. It has a short growing season and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Eritrichium falcatum is often found in meadows and on slopes at high elevations.
